title: Lincolnshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: extra security checks at events this weekend .
appeal for help to find missing prisoner .
general election : ukip leader campaigns in grimsby .
lincoln mayor appeals for food bank donations .

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: well that 's it for today , i 'm off to enjoy the sunshine .
we 'll be back on tuesday from 08:00 and updates on breaking news , sport and travel stories will appear here over the weekend .
i 'll leave you with five things we 've found out during the day :
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: prayers in lincoln for manchester attack victims
text: lincolnshire 's religious leaders have met today to pray for the victims of the manchester bomb attack .
representatives from the catholic , anglican and jewish communities joined with muslims during friday prayers at the city 's mosque .
the dean of lincoln , the very reverend christine wilson , says it 's important that faiths unite .

we need to show the way and say that actually we want our children and our grandchildren to be without fear and knowing they have a safe place and environment to live in and a future that 's without fear and that love wins . ''
author: Rod Whiting
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police appeal for missing louth woman
text: police are appealing for help in tracing a missing louth woman who has not had contact with her family since saturday 20 may .
49-year-old sharon simpson and was reported missing from her home yesterday .
police are becoming very concerned for her and have urged anyone who knows her whereabouts to call 101 .
they are also appealing directly to sharon to make contact so her family can be reassured that she is safe .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ant and dec super-fan from sleaford gets surprise visit from her idols
text: an ant and dec super-fan from sleaford has described the 'incredible ' and 'surreal ' moment she met her idols .
the saturday night takeaway stars surprised 25-year-old rebecca grice after best friend katie holmes nominated her to win the 'suzuki surprise ' .
author: Louth Leader

documents.title: lincolnshire man found guilty of sex offences against boy
text: a former lincolnshire police officer and scout master has been found guilty of raping and sexually assaulting a boy younger than 13 .
william wright , 30 , was convicted of eight offences after a trial at lincoln crown court .
he will be sentenced at a later date .

in 2011 , he was given an indefinite sentence for public protection , with a minimum term of three years and 10 months , after pleading guilty to 32 sexual offences , including sexual assault , enticing a girl to engage in pornography and making indecent images of a child .
wright , formerly of townhill lane , bucknall , lincolnshire , was described by police at the time as a dangerous predatory paedophile '' .
author: Oliver Wright
BBC News Online, Yorkshire

documents.title: 'frightening ' 80-mile hospital trip
text: a lincolnshire woman 's described how her injured son was taken on an 80 mile trip to get hospital treatment .
adele crompton-allan from great gonerby says she had to drive her 7-year-old son , who broke his arm , from their home near grantham to lincoln accident and emergency unit .
grantham a & e was shut and she was told there 'd be a long wait for an ambulance .
harry was then taken to the qmc in nottingham .

if the a & e was open it would have been a shorter journey for us only being a great gonerby anyway we could have got to grantham quickly , they could 've stabilised him , they could 've given him all the necessary drugs for pain relief and everything which could have made him more comfortable earlier before we had to be transferred anywhere .
it was not good .
emas have apologised to the family saying they are sorry that they could not get to the patient sooner .

there were ambulances in the area and a crew were on their way to the child , however as the family informed us they were making their own way to hospital the ambulance crew were made available to respond to the next emergency .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: boston looking lovely in the sunshine
text: thank you to jason t one of our lincolnshire weather watchers for this amazing of boston stump today .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln city season tickets selling fast
text: lincoln city have sold over 3,500 season tickets for next season , the club have confirmed .
however , a number of fans are still to renew their season tickets meaning the figure could rise to over 4,000 .
imps managing director kevin cooke says he hopes attendances at sincil bank will continue to rise .
we averaged just over 5,000 people this season , but you know attednances started lower and then they were really high towards the end of the season i would hope that we would beat that this season .
34 % of you think we will sell over 5,000 season tickets .
let 's make it happen !
download your application form here
most out dated ticketing system in the football league .
download a form , fill it out stand in a huge queue & be as expensive as championship
that 's cause until now they 've not had the cash to upgrade it .
now they have but it 's not something you can introduce overnight
i think they could be smarter than 1 ticket window .
they could 've had tables in the bar and had 3 or 4 serving at a time .
wish them success
you would sell more if you could buy online .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: warning of lakes swimming danger
text: people are being warned of the dangers of swimming in open water following several incidents of children jumping into the lakes at hartsholme country park and swanholme lakes .
city of lincoln council 's park rangers have issued a warning to people to keep out of the water as the hot weather continues and half-term approaches .

apart from the obvious danger of hitting rocks or hidden debris , the lake is very deep and if someone swimming were to get into difficulty it could become a very dangerous situation , as it would be hard to reach anyone who gets into trouble . ''
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ukip leader campaigns in grimsby
text: the ukip leader paul nuttall has been campaigning in grimsby today where he called for foreign aid to be scrapped and the money used to help fund the nhs .
election campaigning was postponed until today following the manchester terrorist attack .
speaking to bbc radio humberside the ukip leader said he 's not sure the prime minister theresa may will 'get the job done ' over a strong brexit deal .
the negotiations have n't even started yet and it 's very easy for theresa may to talk the talk and act tough .
let 's see what happens when she has to walk the walk . ''

documents.title: former councillor jailed over indecent images of children
text: a 72 year old south lincolnshire man has today been jailed for 8 months for viewing indecent images of children .
peter bird of east street , crowland , a former parish councillor and special constable , admitted the charges .
the judge told him that children had been abused in the making of the material .
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: blue skies across the county
text: here are two lovely sent in by some bbc lincolnshire weather watchers this morning .
this countryside view was taken at caythorpe by milliegeorge & me .
this shot of a lincoln knight on steep hill was sent in by isle explorer .
thanks both for sending them in !
if you want to become one of our weather watchers click here for more details .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today :
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: more opportunities to learn cpr this weekend
text: there 's another chance to learn livesaving cpr skills this weekend as part of bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign .
the station 's trying to get 10,000 people to learn the skill .
at the start of the week , we announced the 3,000 mark had been passed - and it should be closer to 4,000 after this weekend .
our partners , lives and st john ambulance , will be at an event in sleaford , the family fun fest at the town 's rugby club .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: you 're invited to our candidates ' debate in lincoln
text: as you may know , i 've been holding a series of election candidates ' debates .
we 've had to make a few changes because of the suspension of campaigning by the political parties after the manchester terrorist attack .
but it 's continuing next week in lincoln , and we 'll be teaming up with the lincolnite to bring you the debate on monday 5 june at the drill hall at 19:15 .
we want as many of you there as possible , so please register to attend .
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: toilet block beach hut wins award
text: toilet block beach hut wins award

documents.title: lincoln mayor appeals for food bank donations
text: the mayor of lincoln , councillor chris burke went to the ermine community larder earlier this week to officially launch this year 's mayoral charity .
he has chosen to help all of lincoln 's food banks and community larders and went along to see what needs to be done to make a difference .
these important places are very short on food , and these may be things that you have extra at home and would happily donate .
i would encourage everyone to at least have a look to see if there is anything they can spare , and to help us feed those in need by dropping food items off at one of the seven venues in lincoln .
food banks and community larders will take any food as long as it is packaged in 'as new ' condition and it is well within its best before date .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: 'huge ' levels of investment in the lincolnshire coast
text: nearly fifty million pounds is currently being invested into the lincolnshire coast according to east lindsey district council .
it includes the £ 16m redevelopment of the former skegness town football club ground and almost ten million pounds bringing premier inn , kfc and brewer 's fayre to skegness .
many hotels and caravan sites are booked out for the bank holiday weekend .
definitely seems to be busier this year .
i wonder whether it 's because people are n't going abroad or staying away from the big towns at the moment and saying let 's go to the seaside .
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: have you seen this man ?
text: a prisoner has absconded from a prison near boston .
nicky ward , 36 , has been absent from hmp north sea camp since wednesday night .
police say he has links to skegness but is from south yorkshire .
he 's described as 6'2 '' tall with black hair and green eyes .
if you think you have seen him , or have any information concerning his whereabouts , lincolnshire police ask you to call 101 .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire roads are 'dangerous for bikes '
text: a superbike champion in lincolnshire is calling for more potholes to be mended in lincolnshire .
steve plater says the county 's roads are dangerous for bikes .
in some places it could be life threatening .

there are quite a few potholes and for a motorcycle or a cyclist in the middle of a corner , if you were to lose control through a pothole and fall off there only has to be something , not even major vehicle wise , coming the other way .
that could be catastrophic .
the county council says it 's fixed more than 200,000 potholes in the past two years , but councillor for highways richard davies admits they need to do more .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: the breakfast club : exams edition
text: did your mum ever tell you to not skip breakfast because it 's the most important meal of the day ?
well for the young people who 're in the middle of all their exams , it 's all the more important to get the day off to a good start !
boston grammar school 's now started a breakfast club for students during this exam period .
@ twitterid has started a free breakfast club for students before their gcse and a level exams , good idea eh ?
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: extra security checks at events this weekend
text: following the manchester bombing on monday and the uk threat level being raised to critical , lincolnshire police are telling gig-goers to expect extra security checks this weekend .
if you 're going to radio 1 's big weekend in hull or two big planned music gigs on the lincolnshire showground you 'll need to allow extra time .
inspector mark garthwaite from lincolnshire police says you should n't be alarmed if you see armed officers .
they 're still police officers , they just happen to have a very high level of training and they 're very professional and proficient with what they 've got .
but by all means go and chat to them .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here 's the top stories so far this morning from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : get your sun cream on
text: it 's going to be a scorcher - with highs of 25c ( 77f ) .
today will be dry , sunny and very warm again inland .
it will be more breezy than yesterday and it 'll feel cooler along the coast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to friday 's live coverage
text: good morning from sunny lincoln .
we 're back again to bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the country .
it 'd be great to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
author: Hope Bolger
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learnt today
text: that 's it for this thursday .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 and updates on breaking news , sport and travel stories will appear her throughout the night .
i 'm off now to enjoy what 's left of the beautiful blue skies - but before i disappear , let 's look back at five things we 've found out during the day :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: superbike champ gives council a rough ride over potholes
text: a superbike racer from lincolnshire says the state of the county 's roads is appalling .
isle of man tt champion steve plater ( in action below ) says potholes are causing real problems for bikers .
lincolnshire county council says it 's fixed more than two hundred thousand potholes in the past two years .
there 's more on this story on tonight 's look north on bbc 1 at 18.30 .
lincolnshire seems to have a drastic problem with the surface of its roads .
many , many potholes in various places , which in my opinion are very dangerous . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: new queue at sincil bank - this time for trophy selfies
text: it 's been a familiar scene at lincoln city over the past few months - queues for fa cup tickets , season tickets and last-game-of-the-season tickets .
but now young fans and their mums and dads are outside the vip lounge hoping to get a with the national league trophy .
if you want to get in on the action like these young fans - the trophy will be there until 20.00 .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: football : habergham signs contract extension
text: the lincoln city full back sam habergham has signed a one year extension to his contract .
habergham made 56 appearances for the imps last season as they won promotion back to the football league and reached the quarter finals of the fa cup .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: mine 's a pint : beer festival begins
text: the lincoln beer festival is underway - but as you can see from the below the organisers are taking security very seriously in the wake of the manchester bomb attack :
despite the bag searches there are plenty of beer lovers at the event at lincoln 's drill hall - and the festival has spilled outside into the sunshine :
if you 're thinking of heading there to test a couple of brews , wait until 18.00 because that 's when it reopens .
it 's also on tomorrow and saturday from noon until 23.00 .
author: William Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: standing in silence for the victims of manchester bomb attack
text: here are the scenes across the region as people took a minute at 11:00 to reflect on monday night 's concert suicide bomb , and the people affected :
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: open top seasiders back on the prom
text: it 's a real sign that summer 's on the way - the skegness seasider open top buses are back on the road :
it 's glorious out there in # skegness come down and join our # skegseasiders for some fun in the sun
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: david bellamy presides over environmental awards
text: community groups , businesses , farmers and schools will find out today if they 've won a lincolnshire environmental award .
the panel of judges is being chaired once again by the environmentalist professor david bellamy .
the awards , which are organised by the lincolnshire wildlife trust , began 25 years ago - and today 's winners will be presented with their awards at a ceremony in lincoln later .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: rnli issues swimming warning ahead of bank holiday weekend
text: if you 're heading to the lincolnshire coast this bank holiday weekend then you 're being urged by the rnli to think carefully before jumping into the sea .
it 's as research has shown that the sudden immersion into cold water can put people into cold water shock- which can trigger the instinctive reaction to swim hard and possibly drown .
instead they say you should try to float until the effects of shock pass .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: football : trinity to host doncaster rovers in pre-season friendly
text: gainsborough trinity bosses have announced they 'll welcome their near neighbours doncaster rovers as the highlight of their pre-season fixtures .
prices are still to be confirmed for the match , which will take place at the northolme on monday , 31 july .
the national league proper begins on saturday 5 august .
author: James Williams
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : mainly sunny and warm
text: the warm weather continues this afternoon - but it could be cloudy towards the coast :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: canadian fighter in scampton show line-up
text: the organisers of the scampton airshow have announced that the royal canadian air force has agreed to send one of its jets to the event .
the cf-18 hornet fighter will be part of the static display at raf scampton for the show , which will take place on 9 and 10 september .
show director paul sall says the history between lincolnshire and the royal canadian air force is `` undeniably strong '' with many rcaf personnel based in the county in the second world war .
the connection with raf scampton is particularly of note , with 30 members of the legendary 617 dambusters squadron being royal canadian air force . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police officers and staff observe minute 's silence
text: here 's a from lincolnshire police hq in nettleham , near lincoln :
scenes like this were reflected across the county this morning as people observed a silence for the victims of monday 's suicide bomb in manchester .
twenty-two people were killed and 64 injured after suicide bomber salman abedi detonated a homemade device at manchester arena .
manchester 's council invited people `` to pay your respects to those we lost '' .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: man in critical condition after 'serious assault '
text: a 50-year-old man is in hospital with serious injuries after being found at a house in gainsborough .
police say he was discovered in salisbury street in gainsborough at around 11:30 yesterday morning .
an appeal 's been made to anyone who might have seen or heard anything sus in the area overnight between tuesday and wednesday to come forward .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: morning mist gives way to blue skies
text: here are two lovely sent in by some bbc lincolnshire weather watchers from this morning .
the one on the right was taken at dawn near spalding by overthebridge , on the left is a taken in fosdyke by greenman .
thanks both for sending them in !
if you want to become one of our weather watchers click here for more details .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: manchester attack : national minute 's silence to be held
text: people across lincolnshire are being invited to take part in a national minute 's silence at 11:00 in memory of the victims of the manchester terror attack on monday .
twenty-two people were killed and 64 injured after a suicide bomber detonated a device at manchester arena .
manchester 's council has invited people `` to pay your respects to those we lost '' .

documents.title: domesday book arrives in lincoln
text: the domesday book has arrived at lincoln castle .
it 's the first time the 900 year old public record has ever been loaned outside london .
it 's being displayed in a special vault alongside lincoln 's copy of magna carta and the charter of the forest .
the loan was organised by the historic lincoln trust .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: police forces to observe silence at 11.00
text: both of the police forces which cover our part of the world have announced they will observe today 's silence for the victims of the manchester suicide bomb on monday .
here are tweets from both :
at 11am @ twitterid will observe a minutes silence for the victims of the manchester attack
moving to hear @ twitterid read the names and ages of known victims inevitably translated them to my own family and the grief felt
a single red rose why we love our emergency services me x paramedicgrahamsings
send a single white rose why pure innocence me x paramedicgrahamsings
we will be observing a minute 's silence at 11am in remembrance of those who lost their lives and were affected by the attack in manchester .

documents.title: new hotel gets nod from planners
text: lincoln is getting a new hotel - after planning officers approved it last night .
developers want to build the travelodge on tentercroft street .
the proposals include plans for more than 120 bedrooms on a site next to the new east west link road .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: your weather this morning
text: it will be another dry , sunny and very warm day .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Sara Thornton
BBC Weather

documents.title: welcome to thursday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
we 're back again to bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or messaging on facebook or twitter .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingraf wittering postpones parade following manchester attack
text: some news we 've just received from the raf - their parade marking the freedom of the town in stamford tomorrow has been postponed , following the uk terror threat level being raised to `` critical '' .

raf wittering spokesman ed palmer told bbc look east : `` in consultation with lincolnshire police and in line with national police guidelines raf wittering has reluctantly decided to postpone the parade marking the freedom of stamford tomorrow .
`` although we are not aware of any specific threat to stamford or raf wittering , we believe it would be more appropriate to hold the parade at a later date .
`` raf wittering apologises for any disappointment and thanks the people of stamford and the nearby communities for their continuing support . ''

documents.title: goodbye : five things we 've learned today
text: so that 's it for wednesday - we 'll be back tomorrow from 08.00 and updates on major news , sport and travel stories will appear here throughout the night .
just before we head off into the sunshine this evening , let 's look back at five things we 've found out during the day :
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: police in city centre to reassure shoppers
text: we 've already seen the cars around the cathedral and castle at lunchtime but if you 're shopping in lincoln this afternoon you might bump into these officers .
they 're part of the lincolnshire police operation to reassure people after the manchester suicide bombings .
the county 's chief constable bill skelly says you 'll be seeing more armed police on the streets over the next few days and at major events planned over the coming weeks .
author: Lucy Parry
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: can you help find missing nicole ?
text: concern is growing for nicole rae from scunthorpe after she went missing from home .
police say she is in the latter stages of pregnancy and they 're keen to make sure she 's getting the care she needs .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: funding boost for bomber command centre
text: the team behind the bomber command centre near lincoln have received a boost .
they 've been struggling to find the £ 2m needed to finish the project .
but they 've just been awarded £ 700,000 from biffa - which provides grants from landfill tax .
as the above shows work is progressing on the centre , which is being built next to the international bomber command spire on canwick hill , on the outskirts of lincoln .
it 's being built to remember more than one million men and women who served or supported lincolnshire-based bomber command during the second world war .
it 's due to open in december .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : lincoln broadgate reopen
text: here 's the latest from stagecoach buses in lincoln :
looks like broadgate is reopen - but the delays will continue .
# lincoln , broadgate just reopened , services operating back on route , please expect delays due to congestion , up to 20 minutes currently .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: extra security for lincolnshire showground gigs this weekend
text: the organisers of music concerts at the lincolnshire showground ( below ) this weekend say there will be increased security .
razorlight are performing on friday night - the human league on saturday .
organisers have been rethinking their approach to the events after monday 's suicide bombing in manchester .
jayne southall from the lincolnshire showground says they are monitoring the situation but extra security will not affect people 's enjoyment of the gigs .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: delays on pelham bridge after taxi crashes into central reservation
text: there are long delays on broadgate heading to pelham bridge in lincoln after a taxi crashed into the central reservation .
author: The Lincolnite

documents.title: starring role for city in fa cup programme
text: recognise the scene behind solomon in the below ?
it 's from the opening minute of a new bbc programme about this year 's fa cup run .
ok , so you 've spotted it - it 's lincoln 's steep hill .
a lot of the half-hour programme features lincoln and , of course , lincoln city , after the team 's heroics saw them reach the quarter final of the competition .
catch up with the programme here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: appeal after string of lincoln arson attacks
text: arsonists have been blamed for three fires in lincoln .
police say the incidents have all happened in the last few days on hall drive , in the boultham area of the city .
all three fires happened on sunday and monday .
there 's an appeal for witnesses to get in touch .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: increased police presence in tourist areas
text: we 've just been sent these from outside lincoln cathedral ( top ) and the city 's castle - two tourist hotspots .
specialist police have been drafted in today to reassure people after the manchester attack on monday .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: weather : warm but cloudy afternoon
text: here 's the forecast for this afternoon - cloud building later - bit the sun should return this evening :
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: football : imps scoop 'giant killer ' award
text: lincoln city have just been awarded the fa giant-killing award after their fa cup heroics .
the prize is given to clubs who beat opposition many places higher than themselves in the competition .
the imps were up against millwall , stourbridge and sutton united , who all had fantastic runs in the cup .
but in the end , a public vote chose lincoln city as the winner .
the fa said 69 % of votes were cast for the performance against burnley at turf moor , and the award will be presented at the fa cup final at the emirates stadium on saturday .
the victory at turf moor was an unforgettable day for all involved at the club .
our exploits in the emirates fa cup are something we can all be very proud of and we 'll continue to reap the benefits of our achievements in the competition for many years to come .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: armed officers on streets in lincolnshire
text: lincolnshire 's chief constable bill skelly has just released a statement after armed officers were deployed on the streets of the county .

mr skelly says we wo n't see soldiers on the streets , but military capability will be there if needed after the terror threat level was raised to `` critical '' in the wake of the suicide bomb in manchester .
there are a number of events planned across the county coming up which people might be worried about .
we are working with organisers to ensure those events are as safe and secure as possible and we hope that you are still able to go and enjoy them . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: iron keeper to leave glanford park
text: scunthorpe united goalkeeper luke daniels is leaving glanford park after signing a three-year deal with brentford .
daniels had made 109 appearance and helped the club to the league one play-offs this season , but was out of contract .
he 's the second goalkeeping departure after joe anyon left for chesterfield .
author: Rob Makepeace
BBC Radio Lincolnshire sport

documents.title: inquest verdict on gp who died eight days after retirement
text: a coroner has found a gp whose bicycle was in collision with a bus died as a result of a road traffic collision .
dr charles lennon was cycling on the a15 in thurlby near bourne when the incident happened .
the gp , who had worked at munro medical centre in spalding for almost 30 years , had retired just eight days before the incident , in november .
a statement on the surgery website at the time said : `` it is with great sadness that we share the news of the tragic death of dr charles lennon who retired from the practice on 31 october . ''
author: David McKenna
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: armed police on skegness seafront
text: here 's a that 's just been sent in from skegness showing armed officers on patrol on the seafront this morning .
it 's not clear where the officers are being deployed across the county , but they 've also been spotted in lincoln city centre .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: council to introduce £ 75 dog fouling fine
text: a new public space protection order has been agreed in part of lincolnshire which will see fines of £ 75 dished out to people who let their dogs foul public areas .
it will cover all areas in west lindsey to `` which the public have a right or entitlement of access '' and comes into force on 5 june .

this order is the first step of many to target environmental offences and improve public areas as part of a new envirocrime strategy , by engaging the public to assist us in identifying hot spots , and targeting our resources . ''

documents.title: listen : lincolnshire taxi driver 's manchester bomb rescue bid
text: i 've been talking to paul jowett , a taxi driver from skegness , who was in manchester on monday night after dropping a two boys off in manchester for the ariana grande concert .
he told me the boys , aged 19 and 11 , made it out of the arena , but then he faced an anxious search for them among the crowds :
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this morning
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: new hotel plan on the agenda
text: plans for a new hotel in lincoln could be approved later today .
an application 's been put in by developers for a travelodge on tentercroft street .
if approved , the hotel , which will be built on a site next to the new east west link road , will have more than 120 bedrooms over five floors .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: concern as foodbank donations dry up
text: foodbanks in lincolnshire say there 's been a drop in the amount of donations .
the storehouse in skegness and the larder in lincoln ( below ) say they 're struggling to cope with demand .
foodbank volunteers and staff say they 're having to buy the food themselves .
people in skegness are very generous .
it 's just the demand for the product outweighs what we 've got coming in .
we are very low , a lot of the pallets are empty now , there are certain things we have got none of .
until we can get some more brought in the parcels are very sparse .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : another warm day on the way
text: plenty of strong sunshine today although there will be cool sea breezes along the coast later .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to wednesday 's live coverage
text: good morning from lincoln .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county until 18:00 today .
we love to hear from you , so get in touch by sending an email , or by messaging us on facebook or twitter .
send in your news or info about what 's happening where you are and we 'll try to include it here .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: wwii veteran claims medals after 72 years
text: wwii veteran claims medals after 72 years

documents.title: five things we 've learned today
text: so that 's it for tuesday - we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow and updates on breaking news , sport and travel will continue here throughout the night .
let 's look back at five things we 've learned today :
bye for now !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: firefighters practice boat skills
text: here 's a video from louth fire and rescue showing how they 've been training for water rescue .
looks like someone 's also been practicing their filming using a drone as well :
we 've been honing our boat handling skills at covenham reservoir .
man overboard drills , leaving and coming alongside # notjustfires
great video

documents.title: coming up on look north - at a slightly later time
text: here 's peter levy with what 's coming up on the programme tonight - it 's on at 18:55 after an extended national news covering the manchester terror attacks :
here are the latest headlines from @ twitterid we 're on slightly later tonight at 18:55
author: BBC Look North
East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this afternoon
text: here are the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: traffic and travel : broken down vehicle on m180
text: a lane 's closed on the m180 westbound between j2 for the a161 for gainsborough and and j1 for the a18 and a614 at thorne .
it 's because of a broken down vehicle .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: lincoln students to observe silence this evening
text: we 've heard from the university of lincoln students ' union about a minute 's silence they are holding at 18:00 tonight to remember victims of the manchester terror attack .
the union says the event will be timed to coincide with manchester students ' union 's own vigil , with students invited to meet outside the union building on the lincoln campus at 17:50 .
author: Katie O'Halloran
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: watch : any other business : 'will you marry me ? '
text: yesterday we were telling you how the council chamber at lincolnshire county council broke into spontaneous applause when there was a marriage proposal .
martin trollope-bellew was making his final speech as a councillor when he decided to pop the question .
here 's the moment it happened :
you 'll be pleased to know that despite her hesitation here - it did n't take long for rosemary woolley to accept .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: medals recovered by police - do you recognise them ?
text: police in boston have released these today - they 're part of a collection of commemorative coins and medals .
it 's thought they may have been stolen in a burglary .
they 're appealing for you to get in touch if you know where they belong .

documents.title: police chief : no extra patrols in lincolnshire
text: senior police in lincolnshire say there will be no change in the way the county is policed in the wake of last night 's terror attack in manchester .
assistant chief constable paul gibson ( below ) has released a statement on the force website this afternoon to deliver a `` be alert , not alarmed '' message .
we are very aware that people might feel anxious about if an attack like this could take place in lincolnshire ; we are closely monitoring the situation here and will respond accordingly .

at the moment our position is unchanged in the county , policing is being delivered according to our normal routine , and we will be constantly assessing that in light of the events in manchester . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincoln woman dies after motorbike crash
text: a woman who has died after the motorbike she was riding was in collision with a car in lincolnshire yesterday has been named by police .
naomi fox , who was 37 and from lincoln , suffered serious injuries in the crash at around 15:50 yesterday .
officers say she died this morning .
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: cathedral visitors light candles for manchester attack victims
text: here 's a video from lincoln cathedral this lunchtime - where visitors have been remembering those involved in the terror attack in manchester last night .
similar scenes are taking place around the county , and the country , as people try to come to terms with what 's happened , as the names of victims are made public .
author: Sharon Edwards
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: lincolnshire 's johnny strikes gold at chelsea
text: on a day of darkness and difficulty , it 's nice to hear that lincolnshire 's johnny walkers has had more success at the chelsea flower show .
mr walkers , who 's worked for holbeach-based taylors bulbs for more than a quarter of a century , has the midas touch when it comes to daffs .
it 's his 24th consecutive gold at chelsea - blooming marvellous !
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: county beaches fly the flag for cleanliness
text: three of lincolnshire 's beaches are among the best and cleanest in the world .
the central beaches in skegness ( below ) , mablethorpe and sutton on sea have all retained their blue flag status .
the blue flag is awarded to beaches which meet strict water quality standards and helps local councils market their destinations to tourists .
it 's a symbol that most people are now familiar with and it means it 's a good safe bathing beach . ''
author: Corazon Garcia
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: cathedral 's service for manchester attack victims
text: i 'm at lincoln cathedral this lunchtime where people have gathered to say prayers for people affected by the manchester suicide attack .
the below shows a candle held in the arms of an angel which clergy light at times of national grief and shock .
i 've been speaking to people here - there 's a real sense of solidarity with those affected .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: a46 reopens after crash
text: the a46 has been cleared at welton , north of lincoln , after a three-car crash .
it 's not known if there were any serious injuries .
the road was completely closed for around two hours after the collision which happened in this morning 's rush hour , close to the centurion garage .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: manchester attack : city council opens book of condolence
text: this just tweeted by the city of lincoln council shows its leader , councillor ric metcalfe , signing a book of condolence opened by the authority this lunchtime following the manchester suicide attack :
the council is also flying its flag at half mast above the stonebow in lincoln city centre :
a book of condolence has been opened at city hall and everyone is invited to sign and share their messages with the people of manchester
author: BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: more armed police on streets after manchester attack
text: there will be more police on the streets in north lincolnshire and north east lincolnshire in response to last night 's suicide attack in manchester which killed 22 people and injured 59 .
humberside police has released a statement this morning from assistant chief constable andy dyer .
he said : `` there is no information suggesting an imminent threat to our area at this time .
we are taking all possible steps to keep people safe and to minimise the risk of a terrorist attack occurring in our force area .

`` the public will see an enhanced policing presence , including armed police , across humberside as the uk police , together with security and intelligence services , work around the clock to keep communities safe . ''
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: prayers for victims of manchester attack
text: clergy at lincoln cathedral have lit a special candle as a focus for prayers for those involved in the manchester attack last night .
stamford all saints ' church ( above ) is also holding a half-hour prayers for peace eucharist at noon today `` for those wanting help to think through the dreadful events in manchester ''
the church says people from all faiths are welcome
author: Sharon Edwards
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: deputy chief constable moves on after a year
text: the deputy chief constable of lincolnshire police , gary knighton , is leaving the force after just over a year .
mr knighton , was assistant chief constable in derbyshire when he joined lincolnshire police in february 2016 .
he 's now heading back to derbyshire as deputy chief constable .
congratulations to dcc knighton on his appointment as the next deputy chief constable at derbyshire .
we wish him very well in his new role and i 'm very grateful for all of the work he 's put in in lincolnshire over the last year . ''
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: woman dies after middle rasen crash
text: the police have just confirmed that a woman 's died after a crash at middle rasen , north of lincoln , yesterday .
officers say the victim , who was in her 30s and from the lincoln area , was riding a motorbike when it collided with a car at around 15:50 yesterday .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ukip leader and boston candidate suspends campaign after manchester attack
text: here 's the latest from paul nuttall - the ukip leader and boston and skegness general election candidate :

documents.title: listen : lincoln mum 's shock over manchester attack
text: sally from lincoln was at manchester arena on saturday for a take that concert .
she called me this morning and spoke on air .
she says she feels like she had a lucky escape :
author: Scott Dalton
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: flags fly at half mast after manchester attack
text: the flags at lincolnshire police hq ( below left ) and north kesteven district council in sleaford ( below right ) are flying at half mast today after the explosion at manchester arena last night .

documents.title: police chiefs meeting in lincolnshire after manchester attack
text: lincolnshire 's most senior police are gathering this morning as part of a so-called gold command meeting .
they will be discussing their response to the manchester attack with a view to major events in the region this summer .
click here to read what we know so far about what happened last night :
it comes as the prime minister is chairing a meeting of the national emergency committee cobra .
greater manchester police chief constable ian hopkins said he was treating the attack as terror .
if it is confirmed to be a terrorist attack , it would be the worst in the uk since 52 people were killed in the london bombings of july 2005 .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: manchester terror attack : county reacts
text: people across lincolnshire are expressing their shock and disbelief this morning at the attack on manchester arena overnight .
the county 's police and crime commissioner marc jones has just been speaking to bbc radio lincolnshire .
he took his eight-year-old daughter to her first concert a few days ago - the star was ariana grande - who was on stage in manchester last night .
he says he and his daughter are deeply shocked by what 's happened .

he also says senior officers in the county are looking at how this attack will affect security for major events in the county , and added greater manchester police will receive help from our force if requested .
my heart goes out to all at # manchersterarena @ twitterid concert last night .
i took my 8yo to see ag this week in brum .
simply shocked
awful .
truly awful .
thought of you when i saw it .
really awful .
i was only thinking about you & your daughter at 4am this morning & had an awful fear you might have been in manchester .
phew ! !
xx
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: a46 crash : road now completely closed
text: there 's an update on that crash on the a46 at welton from lincolnshire police .
the road is now completely blocked .
police say it wo n't be open till around 11:00 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: election debate cancelled after manchester attack
text: radio lincolnshire was planning to hold a live election debate in grantham this morning ahead of next month 's vote - that 's now cancelled because of the events in manchester .
it comes after all general election campaigning across the country was called off by the main parties .
at least one of our candidates , gainsborough 's sir edward leigh , has also announced he wo n't be on the doorsteps this morning :
my campaign & constituency tour is halted today as our thoughts and prayers turn to everyone involved in last night 's attack in # manchester
author: Melvyn Prior
Presenter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: listen : cleethorpes family caught up in manchester attack
text: we 've been speaking to kelly page from cleethorpes who took her daughters to the pop concert in manchester , where a suicide attack killed 22 and injured 59 .
she told us how it all unfolded :
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: a46 jams after welton accident
text: the a46 northbound is blocked because of an accident involving two vehicles .
emergency services are on their way .
at the moment there 's no access to welton from the a46 .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: your weather for today
text: another dry day with warm sunshine , but some cloud at times .
here 's my full forecast :
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: a1 problems after five-car crash
text: there 's a lane blocked on the a1 southbound this morning because of an accident .
there are five cars involved at the b6403 stamford road .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: welcome to tuesday 's live coverage
text: hello , it 's martin with you in lincoln today to bring you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
if you want to get in touch you can .
just send me an email , or a message on facebook or twitter .
send me your or any news or info about what 's happening where you are .
author: Martin Slack
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: that 's all folks !
text: that 's it from me for today , thanks for the company !
your news , sport , travel and weather updates will continue through the evening .
i 'll leave you with five things we did n't know this morning :
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: ambulance crash investigated
text: an investigation is under way after an ambulance was involved in a collision with a car near boston .
it happened on the a52 at friskney just before 09:00 this morning .
east midlands ambulance service say four people were taken to hospital and the air ambulances was called to the scene .
no one was seriously injured .
author: Maggie Curtis
News Editor, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: almost 200 more people now know cpr
text: radio lincolnshire 's aim to teach 10,000 people vital life saving skills has moved a step closer .
almost 200 pupils and parents have been learning cpr at sturton by stow primary school today as part of the radio station 's campaign .
at the end of the day parents came into school to learn cpr .
today almost 200 people have been trained .
@ twitterid @ twitterid # savealife
please enter into educational establishment of the year category @ twitterid for this amazing work you are doing .
free to enter !
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: tonight 's forecast
text: dry tonight and another warm day tomorrow
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: loader stolen in lincolnshire
text: detectives are asking for help to locate a loader stolen from near louth
stolen avant loader similar to stolen from building site , brackenborough on 13/05 .
any sightings / info call 101 inc 150 15/5
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: time ticking to register
text: people in lincolnshire are being reminded of the deadline to register to vote in the general election .
the electoral commission says around seven million people are n't on the register .
eligible voters have until midnight to submit their details .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: pupils practice cpr
text: pupils and parents have been learning cpr at sturton by stow primary school today as part of bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign .
the radio station is aiming to teach 10,000 people these vital life saving skills .
all children and staff in school have now completed their cpr training with @ twitterid as part of the @ twitterid # savealife campaign .
this is fantastic and i am pleased to say jude and myley gave us a demonstration when they got home and they were brilliant thank you
our grandaughter katya , loves all she learns at school and we would trust her with our lives any day , thank you
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: ambulance crash
text: an ambulance has been involved in a collision near boston .
it happened on the a52 at friskney just before 09:00 this morning .
east midlands ambulance service say four people were taken to hospital - no one was seriously injured .
author: Maggie Curtis
News Editor, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: drug dealer sent to young offenders institution
text: a drug dealer who assaulted a policeman at grantham railway station has been sent to a young offenders institution for two and a half years .
sandro pires dos santos was stopped for a drugs search .
he had to spend five days in hospital after eating a number of plastic bags containing heroin and cocaine .
the 19 year old of no fixed address admitted four charges at lincoln crown court .
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: missing 16-year-old
text: police say they 're growing increasingly concerned for a missing 16 year old boy who could be in the grantham area .
braydon forbes disappeared from nottinghamshire last tuesday .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: any other business : 'will you marry me ? '
text: it 's not just local services which are discussed at council meetings - marriages are as well !
martin trollope-bellew popped the question to his long-term partner during a lincolnshire county council meeting .
he was making his final speech as chairman of the authority when he told the meeting that he and councillor rosemary woolley had been close for years .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: they 've had enough rain !
text: after weeks of saying they needed rain , lincolnshire 's farmers are now keen for sunshine !
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: cash machine ram-raid : damage assessed
text: damage to a village store near lincoln is being assessed following a ram-raid .
a cash machine was ripped from the wall at branston co-op in the early hours of sunday morning .
the offenders used a jcb to target the atm .
police are appealing for information and the store is open for business .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: the forecast for this afternoon
text: feeling warm in lincolnshire this afternoon
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: proposal on the agenda
text: two lovebird councillors are planning their wedding following a very public proposal .
martin trollope-bellew popped the question to his long-term partner during a lincolnshire county council meeting .
he was making his final speech as chairman of the authority when he told the meeting that he and councillor rosemary woolley had been close for years .
author: Sharon Edwards
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: your headlines this lunchtime
text: the top stories from our lincolnshire newsroom so far today include :
author: Barbara Stimpson
BBC Radio Lincolnshire News

documents.title: knights put lincoln on the map
text: there was much excitement around the launch of the lincoln knights ' trail at the weekend .
the tourist information centre says it was surprised by how many people came to take the leaflets to complete the trail challenge .
the trail features 36 individually designed statues for people to find across the city centre .
it 's all part of the celebrations for the 800th anniversary of the battle of lincoln .

documents.title: lincolnshire goes on show at chelsea
text: lincolnshire growers are once again competing at the chelsea flower show .
the queen and prince philip are touring the gardens today with the event opening to the public tomorrow .
john cullen , from algarkirk near boston , is one of those taking part .
he specialises in plants which attract bees and butterflies .
author: Suzy Lawson
Broadcast Journalist

documents.title: children learn cpr
text: pupils and parents are learning cpr at sturton by stow primary school today as part of bbc radio lincolnshire 's save a life campaign .
the radio station is aiming to teach 10,000 people these vital life saving skills .
author: Charlotte Wright
BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: homes planned for swinderby
text: you 'll be able to put questions to the developers behind plans for more than 100 homes in swinderby as part of a public meeting later .
representatives from the developers bloombridge will be there along with members of the parish council .
the plans include housing for the elderly , a community car park and shop .
author: Helen Gardner

documents.title: listen : work starts at lincoln cathedral
text: a £ 16m project to upgrade visitor facilities at lincoln cathedral is now under way .
it will include building a new cafe and shop as well as redeveloping the grounds .
around £ 800,000 still needs to be raised .
dr anne irving is the programme manager
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: co-op open despite raid
text: the lincolnshire co-op at branston is open for business today , despite a ram-raid at the weekend .
police believe a jcb was used to remove the atm from the wall , causing substantial damage .
the co-op says repair work will take place over the next few weeks .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: Jake Zuckerman
BBC Look North

documents.title: crowds flock to woodhall spa country show
text: this year 's woodhall spa country show has been deemed a success by the organisers .
the event included livestock , vintage tractors and more than 100 trade stands .
the theme this year was rural crafts which went down well with visitors .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: numbers down at lincoln 's university technical college
text: student numbers are falling at lincoln 's university technical college but senior staff remain confident of its future .
the college , which offers courses in engineering , maths and technology to young people aged 14-19 , can take up to 600 students .
only 214 are currently registered .
principle paul batterbury says `` we 'd love more to come here , but we only want them to come here if this is what they want to do , and that 's our dilemma . ''
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: pollen levels
text: if you have hay fever be aware levels are medium in lincolnshire today .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: this morning 's top stories
text: here are the main stories from our lincolnshire newsroom this morning :
author: Helen Gardner

documents.title: maimed blast scientist gets mod payout
text: maimed blast scientist gets mod payout

documents.title: cash machine theft investigated
text: police are continuing to investigate a ram raid at a lincolnshire co-op store .
it 's believed thieves removed an atm from branston with a jcb in the early hours of sunday morning .
it 's the latest in a series of similar crimes across the county over the past few months .
author: David Sykes
Reporter, BBC Radio Lincolnshire

documents.title: today 's forecast
text: looking good for today
author: Lisa Gallagher
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: welcome to monday 's coverage
text: good morning from lincoln , it 's paul here today .
i 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the county .
if you fancy getting in touch and telling me what 's happening in your area you can do so by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Paul Russell
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire
